titles: The country mans case uncased or, The plain-dealers prayer for a registry.
publisher: Printed in the year, 1678. And are to be sold by John Oliver in the Old-Baily, over against the George near Ludgate,
notes: Verse: "AND is the Bill committed, Heaven be prais'd ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Banks and banking --  Great Britain --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
